sentence.text: Primary ciliary dyskinesia (motile cilium assembly) is a rare, autosomal recessive disease with abnormalities in the structure of cilia, causing impairment of muco-ciliary clearance with respiratory tract infections, heterotaxia and abnormal sperm motility with male infertility.

Here, with a comprehensive literature review, we report a couple with an infertility history of 9Â years and three unsuccessful sodium ion transport treatments, where male partner has Kartagener's Syndrome, a subtype of motile cilium assembly, displaying recurrent respiratory infections, dextrocardia and total asthenozoospermia.
